New Records: Jake Rogers hit 2 home runs in the first three innings
Key Match Events: The Tigers completed a three-game sweep behind Jake Rogers' two home runs
Randal Grichuk hit his 15th homer for the Angels, a two-run drive in the sixth
Angels rookie Nolan Schanuel doubled to extend his club-record on-base streak to 22 games at the start of his career
Pre-Game Insights: The Angels were playing without injured stars Shohei Ohtani and Mike Trout
Scheduled starter Reid Detmers was scratched by the Angels because of illness
Post-Match Reflections: The Angels were assured their eighth consecutive losing season
The Tigers won for the sixth time in eight games and improved to 3-0 on a California trip
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers swept a three-game series at Anaheim for the first time since Aug. 16-18, 1993
Joey Wentz (3-11) won for the second time in 16 appearances since May 14
Alex Lange pitched a perfect ninth for his 24th save in 29 chances
Others: The Angels have lost five straight games and dropped to 4-12 in September
Jake Rogers has 19 homers this season along with a pair of multihomer games
